result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randall S Kuhn

records.addlTxt:
(3:51 PM cases 21CM738, 21CM919, 22CM431 called.) Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Randall S Kuhn in court, in custody. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Randall S Kuhn.
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel. 
Defendant pleads Guilty to 21CM738 Count 1: Misdemeanor Battery and 21CM919 Count 1: Resisting an Officer.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's Guilty pleas and finds the defendant Guilty of 21CM738 Count 1 and 21CM919 Count 1.

Court orders sentence for the defendant to provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs on each count. Any remaining charges including case 22CM431 and uncharged DA case 21EC4090 (per off record discussion to include 21FO1509) are dismissed and read in.
Status conference on July 20, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

9:37 AM cases 21CM738, 21CM919, 22CM431 called. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Randall S Kuhn in court, in custody with Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.
Hearing scheduled for 07/20/2022 at 3:45 PM in Branch 1.

9:56 AM Cases called: 21CM919, 22CM431 & 21CM738. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Randall S Kuhn not in court, in custody and not brought over.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Randall S Kuhn.
Hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Conditions: 
No contact with J.M. 
No contact with Mayo hospital unless for emergency services. 
No contact with 420 Cafe. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold.
Defendant not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia. (Applies to 21CM431 only)
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services.
(Covers 21CM738, 21CM919, & 22CM431)

(Cases 21CM919, 21CM738, 22CM431 are called at 11:43 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Randall Kuhn appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Sonia Anderson. ADA Matthew Kirkpatrick appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Warrants executed in 21CM919, 21CM738. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint in 22CM431. State requests $500 cash bond to cover all cases- recites failures to appear. Defense requests bond continue in 21CM919, 21CM738 and signature bond in 22CM431. Court orders $350 cash bond to cover all 3 cases with various conditions. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 06/13/2022 at 3:30 PM. 
Hearing: 07/05/2022 at 9:30 AM.
